original: ARTICLE 4 CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION 4.1 Confidential Information . The term “Confidential Information” means any information disclosed by one Party to the other (i) prior to the date of this Agreement but with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement, or (ii) pursuant to this Agreement, in each case which is in written, graphic, machine readable or other tangible form and is marked “Confidential,” “Proprietary” or in some other manner to indicate its confidential nature. Confidential Information may also include oral information disclosed by one Party to the other pursuant to this Agreement, pro-vided that such information is designated as confidential at the time of disclosure and reduced to a written summary by the disclosing Party, within thirty (30) days after its oral disclosure, which is marked in a manner to indicate its confidential nature and delivered to the receiving party.
modified:
ARTICLE 4 PROTECTION OF CONFIDENTIAL DATA

4.1 Defined Confidential Data: The term "Confidential Data" encompasses any data or information shared between the Parties, (i) prior to this Agreement, in relation to the subject matter of this Agreement, or (ii) as per the terms of this Agreement, regardless of whether it is in written, graphic, machine-readable, or another tangible form and marked as "Confidential," "Proprietary" or similar indicators. Oral information disclosed pursuant to this Agreement will also be considered Confidential Data if it has been designated as such at the time of disclosure, reduced to a written summary by the disclosing Party within thirty (30) days after its oral disclosure and marked to indicate its confidential nature, and delivered to the receiving party.

In this revised clause, the emphasis shifts from the receiver's responsibility to preserve confidentiality to both parties sharing an obligation to protect the data. The term "Confidential Information" has been changed to "Confidential Data," and a more general phrase, "any information disclosed" is used instead of "the term 'Confidential Information.'" Additionally, the receiving party's role in preserving confidentiality is specified by using the phrase "delivered to the receiving party."

original: 4.2 Obligation . Each Party shall treat as confidential (as set forth herein) all Confidential Information of the other Party, and shall not use such Confidential Information except as contemplated in this Agreement or as otherwise authorized in writing.
modified: 4.2 Disclosure Limitations . Each Party agrees to restrict disclosure (though not limited by this Agreement) of their own Confidential Information to the minimum necessary, and may only utilize such Confidential Information for purposes expressly stated in this Agreement or granted in written consent.

original: Each Party shall implement reasonable procedures to prohibit the unauthorized disclo-sure or misuse of the other Party’s Confidential Information and shall not intentionally disclose such Confidential Information to any third party except as may be necessary or useful in connection with the rights and obligations of such Party under this Agreement, and subject to confidentiality obligations similar to those set forth in this Article 4. Each of the Parties shall use at least the same procedures and degree of care that it uses to prevent the disclosure of its own confidential information of like importance to prevent the disclosure of Confidential Information disclosed to it by the other Party under this Agreement, but in no event less than reasonable care.
ollama_generated: Each Party shall adopt prudent measures to safeguard against accidental or unauthorized disclosure or misuse of the other Party's Confidential Information and shall only intentionally reveal such Confidential Information to a third party when strictly necessary or beneficial in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement, while upholding confidentiality duties equivalent to those outlined in Article 4. Each Party shall ensure they employ at least an equal level of precautions and diligence as they do for protecting their own equally significant confidential information to protect the Confidential Information shared by the other Party under this Agreement. However, such measures must never fall below a reasonable standard of care.

original: 7.6 Waiver . Any failure by either Party to enforce at any time any terms and conditions of this Agreement shall not be considered a waiver of that Party’s right thereafter to enforce such terms and conditions or any other terms and conditions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7.6 Waiver and Forbearance: The omission by either Party to assert rights under this Agreement at any time shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment of such rights, nor shall it be deemed a forbearance that would impair the right to assert those same rights in the future. original: 7.8 Assignment . This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of, and shall be binding upon, the Parties and their respective successors and assigns, but neither Party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other except to a person into which it has merged or who has otherwise succeeded to all or substantially all of the business and assets of the assignor, and who has assumed in writing or by operation of law its obligations under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7.8 Assignment. This Agreement shall benefit only the Parties and shall be binding upon them and their respective successors and assignees. Either Party retains the right to assign this Agreement without seeking the prior written consent of the other, provided that such assignment is made to a third party who has assumed in writing or by operation of law its obligations under this Agreement, and such assignment does not transfer less than all of the assignor's rights, interests, and liabilities related to this Agreement.

original: 7.9 Entire Agreement . This Agreement (including its Exhibits) sets forth the entire agreement between the Parties as to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all previous negotiations, agreements and writings in respect thereto and any usage of trade, and shall not be extended, supplemented or amended except by an instrument in writing duly executed by an authorized officer or representative of each Party.
ollama_generated: 7.9 Scope of Agreement: This Agreement (comprising its Exhibits) is a comprehensive understanding between the Parties pertaining to the outlined subject matter, superseding all prior negotiations, understandings, and written documents related thereto, and any industry standards or customs. Any amendments, supplements, or extensions to this Agreement must be made in writing, signed by an authorized officer or representative from each Party. This provision does not, however, preclude the Parties from making informal discussions or negotiations outside the scope of this formal agreement.

original: AGREEMENT 1. Assignment and Assumption .
ollama_generated:
AGREEMENT 1. Transfer of Obligations and Rights .

In this Agreement, the assignor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to transfer or assign all or any part of its rights and obligations under this Agreement, provided that the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by the terms and conditions herein. Upon such assignment, the assignor shall remain liable for any obligations arising prior to the effective date of the assignment unless specifically released in writing by the other party. The other party shall not unreasonably withhold its consent to an assignment requested by the assignor, but may require the assignee to satisfy reasonable conditions as a prerequisite for granting its consent.

original: a. The Assignor hereby assigns, transfers, and conveys to and in favor of the Assignee all of the Assignor’s right, title, and interest in, to, and under the Transferred Contract, together with its related rights, warranties, remedies, powers, and privileges (collectively, the “ Assigned Rights ”). The Assignee hereby accepts the Assigned Rights.
ollama_generated: b. The Assignee hereby acquires, receives, and assumes from the Assignor all rights, title, and interest in, to, and under the Transferred Contract, including but not limited to its related obligations, warranties, liabilities, powers, and responsibilities (herein referred to as the "Assumed Obligations"). The Assignor acknowledges the transfer of these obligations and agrees to uphold them until fully discharged or released by the Assignee.

original: 4. Counterparts . This Assignment may be executed in counterparts or duplicate originals, all of which shall be regarded as one and the same instrument.
modified:
4. Multiple Executions: This Assignment can be individually signed and delivered by each party as a separate document, but every such executed document will be considered an original and collectively treated as a single binding instrument.

Changes made: The original clause allowed for multiple counterparts or duplicate originals to constitute one and the same instrument. The revised clause allows for individual execution of the agreement but considers each signed document as an original, thus strengthening the necessity for every party's signature in this scenario.
